question: Who do Canadians vote for in a federal election?
possible_answers: A. A candidate whom they want to represent them in Parliament
B. All candidates in their electoral district
C. The best speaker running the election campaign
D. Someone to become the Premier of the province
main_question: Who do Canadians vote for in a federal election?
answer: A. A candidate whom they want to represent them in Parliament
explanatory_sentence: The citizens in each electoral district elect one MP who sits in the House of Commons to represent them, as well as all Canadians.
